inputParams.label: Get Relative Links Method
inputParams.name: relativeLinksMethod
inputParams.description: Select a method to retrieve relative links

options.label: Web Crawl
options.name: webCrawl
options.description: Crawl relative links from HTML URL

options.label: Scrape XML Sitemap
options.name: scrapeXMLSitemap
options.description: Scrape relative links from XML sitemap URL

inputParams.label: Get Relative Links Limit
inputParams.name: limit
inputParams.description: Only used when "Get Relative Links Method" is selected. Set 0 to retrieve all relative links, default limit is 10.
inputParams.warning: Retrieving all links might take long time, and all links will be upserted again if the flow's state changed (eg: different URL, chunk size, etc)

inputParams.label: Selector (CSS)
inputParams.name: selector
inputParams.description: Specify a CSS selector to select the content to be extracted

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Additional metadata to be added to the extracted documents

inputParams.label: Omit Metadata Keys
inputParams.name: omitMetadataKeys
inputParams.description: Each document loader comes with a default set of metadata keys that are extracted from the document. You can use this field to omit some of the default metadata keys. The value should be a list of keys, seperated by comma. Use * to omit all metadata keys execept the ones you specify in the Additional Metadata field

outputAnchors.name: output
outputAnchors.label: Output
outputAnchors.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.name: document
options.label: Document
options.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent

options.name: text
options.label: Text
options.description: Concatenated string from pageContent of documents

data.label: InMemory Cache
data.name: inMemoryCache
data.description: Cache LLM response in memory, will be cleared once app restarted

outputAnchors.name: inMemoryCache
outputAnchors.label: InMemoryCache
outputAnchors.description: Cache LLM response in memory, will be cleared once app restarted

data.label: MongoDB Atlas
data.name: mongoDBAtlas
data.description: Upsert embedded data and perform similarity or mmr search upon query using MongoDB Atlas, a managed cloud mongodb database

inputParams.label: Content Field
inputParams.name: textKey
inputParams.description: Name of the field (column) that contains the actual content

inputParams.label: Embedded Field
inputParams.name: embeddingKey
inputParams.description: Name of the field (column) that contains the Embedding

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Number of top results to fetch. Default to 4

inputParams.label: Fetch K (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: fetchK
inputParams.description: Number of initial documents to fetch for MMR reranking. Default to 20. Used only when the search type is MMR

inputParams.label: Lambda (for MMR Search)
inputParams.name: lambda
inputParams.description: Number between 0 and 1 that determines the degree of diversity among the results, where 0 corresponds to maximum diversity and 1 to minimum diversity. Used only when the search type is MMR

data.label: Ollama Embeddings
data.name: ollamaEmbedding
data.description: Generate embeddings for a given text using open source model on Ollama

inputParams.label: Number of GPU
inputParams.name: numGpu
inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: ollamaEmbedding
outputAnchors.label: OllamaEmbeddings
outputAnchors.description: Generate embeddings for a given text using open source model on Ollama

data.label: Conversational Retrieval QA Chain
data.name: conversationalRetrievalQAChain
data.description: Document QA - built on RetrievalQAChain to provide a chat history component

inputParams.label: Rephrase Prompt
inputParams.name: rephrasePrompt
inputParams.description: Using previous chat history, rephrase question into a standalone question
inputParams.warning: Prompt must include input variables: {chat_history} and {question}

inputParams.label: Response Prompt
inputParams.name: responsePrompt
inputParams.description: Taking the rephrased question, search for answer from the provided context
inputParams.default:
I want you to act as a document that I am having a conversation with. Your name is "AI Assistant". Using the provided context, answer the user's question to the best of your ability using the resources provided.
If there is nothing in the context relevant to the question at hand, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure" and stop after that. Refuse to answer any question not about the info. Never break character.
------------
{context}
------------
REMEMBER: If there is no relevant information within the context, just say "Hmm, I'm not sure". Don't try to make up an answer. Never break character.

inputAnchors.label: Memory
inputAnchors.name: memory
inputAnchors.description: If left empty, a default BufferMemory will be used

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

inputs.responsePrompt:
Instruction for SWR AI Assistant
I want you to act as an expert assistant specifically for my website. Your name is "SWR AI Assistant", and your primary role is to assist users with questions and issues related to the website, using the provided context, sitemap data, and embedded documents. Always focus on providing clear, concise, and helpful responses that guide users through the features and functionalities of the site.

Key Guidelines
Website Reference
Refer to the website URL, https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net, exclusively as "SWR."
Do not generalize this naming or apply it to any other links.
Sitemap Links
Below are the sitemap links you should use when responding to queries. Only reference these links, and if a link is not listed here, respond with:

"This link or page is not currently available in the database."
https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/
Home Page: The main landing page of the website.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/login
Login Page: Allows users to log in to their accounts.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/signup
User Signup Page: Enables individual users to create a new account.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/signupComapny
Company Signup Page: A page where companies can register to create their accounts.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/forgotpassword
Forgot Password Page: Allows users to request a password reset.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/resetPassword/example-resetCode
Password Reset Page: A page where users can reset their password using a specific reset code.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/jobs/application
Job Applications for Admin/Company: A page for the company or admin to view applications submitted for jobs.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/jobs/application/review
Candidate Application Review: Allows candidates to view their application before submitting it or review applications they have already sent.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/user/example-id
User Profile Page: Displays the profile of a user. The example-id represents the user’s unique ID. Accessible by the user themselves, companies, or the admin.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/contact
Contact Page: A page where users can reach out for support or inquiries.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/dashboard/jobapplied
Applied Jobs Dashboard: A dashboard for users to view the jobs they have applied for.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/notification-center
Admin Notification Center: A page for the admin to send notifications to users.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/dashboard/notification
User Notification Dashboard: A dashboard where users can view their received notifications.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/dashboard/savedjobs
Saved Jobs Dashboard: A dashboard for users to view the jobs they have saved.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/application/overview
Application Overview Page: A summary page providing an overview of job applications.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/vuex
Vuex Page: Likely a developer-related or test page for Vuex integration.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/dashboard
User Dashboard: The main dashboard for users to access various features.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/users
Users Management Page (Admin): A page for the admin to manage user accounts.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/skills
Skills Management (Admin): A page for the admin to manage skills in the system.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/categories
Category Management (Admin): A page for the admin to manage categories in the system.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/jobs
Job Management (Admin/Company): A page for the admin or a company to manage jobs, including adding or deleting them. Accessible only to admins or companies.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/about
About Page: A page providing details about the website or organization.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/job/example-id
Job Details Page: Displays the details of a specific job. The example-id represents the job’s unique ID.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/category/example-id
Category Jobs Page: Displays jobs within a specific category. The example-id represents the unique ID of the category.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/findJob
Job Search Page: A page where users can search for job offers and use advanced search filters.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/category
Categories Overview Page: Provides an overview of all job categories.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/not_authorized
Not Authorized Page: A page shown when users try to access unauthorized resources.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/terms_and_conditions
Terms and Conditions Page: Displays the terms and conditions of using the website.

https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net/not_found
404 Not Found Page: A page shown when the requested resource is not found.
Key Priorities
1. Website-Specific Assistance
Focus strictly on the website SWR.
Use the sitemap and embedded documents to inform your responses.
Avoid discussing the structure or details of the sitemap or documents themselves. Use them only to provide accurate, relevant answers about SWR.
2. Clarity, Conciseness, and Links
Respond in a clear, concise, and user-friendly manner.
Always try to respond shortly while including links directly from the sitemap wherever available.
If a link is missing from the sitemap, respond with:
"This link or page is not currently available in the database."

3. Handling Off-Topic or Missing Content
If a question is unrelated to the website, respond with:
"I can assist with questions related to SWR. How can I help you with that?"

Do not suggest or speculate about non-sitemap links or content.
4. Character Consistency
Always remain in character as "SWR AI Assistant."
Avoid addressing topics unrelated to SWR or its features.
Never speculate or fabricate information about SWR or its functionalities.
5. Context Integration
Use the {context} placeholder to dynamically pull accurate details about SWR based on the sitemap and embedded documents.
Tailor responses to the user's queries while adhering strictly to the website's available data.
Important Notes
Stick strictly to the provided sitemap and context.
Refer to https://swrfrontend.azurewebsites.net as "SWR" exclusively.
Do not suggest links or features not explicitly included in the sitemap or database.
Respond succinctly and accurately, ensuring helpfulness and relevance at all times.
Always prioritize guiding users with the information and links available in the sitemap.

data.label: Character Text Splitter
data.name: characterTextSplitter
data.description: splits only on one type of character (defaults to "\n\n").

inputParams.label: Chunk Size
inputParams.name: chunkSize
inputParams.description: Number of characters in each chunk. Default is 1000.

inputParams.label: Chunk Overlap
inputParams.name: chunkOverlap
inputParams.description: Number of characters to overlap between chunks. Default is 200.

inputParams.label: Custom Separator
inputParams.name: separator
inputParams.description: Separator to determine when to split the text, will override the default separator

outputAnchors.name: characterTextSplitter
outputAnchors.label: CharacterTextSplitter
outputAnchors.description: splits only on one type of character (defaults to "\n\n").

data.label: HtmlToMarkdown Text Splitter
data.name: htmlToMarkdownTextSplitter
data.description: Converts Html to Markdown and then split your content into documents based on the Markdown headers

inputParams.label: Chunk Size
inputParams.name: chunkSize
inputParams.description: Number of characters in each chunk. Default is 1000.

inputParams.label: Chunk Overlap
inputParams.name: chunkOverlap
inputParams.description: Number of characters to overlap between chunks. Default is 200.

outputAnchors.name: htmlToMarkdownTextSplitter
outputAnchors.label: HtmlToMarkdownTextSplitter
outputAnchors.description: Converts Html to Markdown and then split your content into documents based on the Markdown headers
outputAnchors.type: HtmlToMarkdownTextSplitter | MarkdownTextSplitter | RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter | TextSplitter | BaseDocumentTransformer | Runnable

data.label: ChatOllama
data.name: chatOllama
data.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

inputParams.label: Temperature
inputParams.name: temperature
inputParams.description: The temperature of the model. Increasing the temperature will make the model answer more creatively. (Default: 0.8). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: JSON Mode
inputParams.name: jsonMode
inputParams.description: Coerces model outputs to only return JSON. Specify in the system prompt to return JSON. Ex: Format all responses as JSON object

inputParams.label: Keep Alive
inputParams.name: keepAlive
inputParams.description: How long to keep connection alive. A duration string (such as "10m" or "24h")

inputParams.label: Top P
inputParams.name: topP
inputParams.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Top K
inputParams.name: topK
inputParams.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat
inputParams.name: mirostat
inputParams.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat ETA
inputParams.name: mirostatEta
inputParams.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Mirostat TAU
inputParams.name: mirostatTau
inputParams.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Context Window Size
inputParams.name: numCtx
inputParams.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048) Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of GPU
inputParams.name: numGpu
inputParams.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Number of Thread
inputParams.name: numThread
inputParams.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Last N
inputParams.name: repeatLastN
inputParams.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Repeat Penalty
inputParams.name: repeatPenalty
inputParams.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient. (Default: 1.1). Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stop
inputParams.description: Sets the stop sequences to use. Use comma to seperate different sequences. Refer to docs for more details

inputParams.label: Tail Free Sampling
inputParams.name: tfsZ
inputParams.description: Tail free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting. (Default: 1). Refer to docs for more details

outputAnchors.name: chatOllama
outputAnchors.label: ChatOllama
outputAnchors.description: Chat completion using open-source LLM on Ollama

inputParams.description: Only when loading JSONL files

inputParams.label: Additional Metadata
inputParams.name: metadata
inputParams.description: Additional metadata to be added to the extracted documents

inputParams.label: Omit Metadata Keys
inputParams.name: omitMetadataKeys
inputParams.description: Each document loader comes with a default set of metadata keys that are extracted from the document. You can use this field to omit some of the default metadata keys. The value should be a list of keys, seperated by comma. Use * to omit all metadata keys execept the ones you specify in the Additional Metadata field

outputAnchors.label: Output
outputAnchors.description: Array of document objects containing metadata and pageContent
